channel.title: AEF forum software?
channel.description:
Does anybody think this forum software is any good, Compared to SMF or any others, It's no vB forum software, But it's good, Heres the link too it's site; [ul][li][url=http://anelectron.com]AEF Home[/url][/li][/ul]
Heres some information on them, First of all it's Free forum software, But heres quotes; This site is the home of the Bulletin Board Software AEF. The full name of AEF is Advanced Electron Forum. This bulletin board software is free software. It is written in PHP and MySQL. AEF has a very simple and easy to use Administration Panel and installing this software is a piece of cake! You can install new themes, customize themes the way you want. The User Control Panel has a simple yet beautiful interface where users can set their preferences for the board. This Bulletin board or forum software has all the general features that a forum software should have. It also includes features such as : - [b]News System[/b] with articles - [b]ShoutBox[/b] - [b]Threaded Mode[/b] for topics - [b]JS DOCK[/b] for easy navigation(A first from AEF) - [b]WYSIWYG Editors[/b] - [b]Customizable Themes[/b] - [b]Language Packs[/b] - [b]Time Zone Adjustment[/b] - [b]Automatic Updates[/b] - [b]Export Files and Database[/b] - [b]Suggest Framework[/b] for usernames while writing PM's - [b]Domdrag for reordering Categories, Forums, emoticons[/b] (A new feature included for the first time ever in a forum software.) Try out AEF today!!! Enjoy, --The AEF Development Team
They also supply forum themes, And have a Webhosting service, With free domains etc.. What are your opinions? I'll post screen shots of their forums in action later.

item.title: AEF forum software?
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

It’s OK. That’s all I’m saying. =[]

Read full topic

item.title: AEF forum software?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“natex, post:2, topic:251375”]No smf really owns it -

I used this forum for about 1 day then jsut changed to smf because it is really bugy - and overall its shet[/quote]

I’ll admit that the Previous versions were bugged, If you tried adding a board it would Just crash the forums, But now the latest versions seem pretty secure, Although there are a few bugs here and there,

I like the layout of It’s Admin CP though, It’s simple, Easy and User-friendly.

Read full topic

item.title: AEF forum software?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Does anybody think this forum software is any good, Compared to SMF or any others,
It’s no vB forum software, But it’s good, Heres the link too it’s site;

[ul][li]AEF Home[/li][/ul]

Heres some information on them, First of all it's Free forum software, But heres quotes;

This site is the home of the Bulletin Board Software AEF. The full name of AEF is Advanced Electron Forum. This bulletin board software is free software. It is written in PHP and MySQL.

AEF has a very simple and easy to use Administration Panel and installing this software is a piece of cake! You can install new themes, customize themes the way you want. The User Control Panel has a simple yet beautiful interface where users can set their preferences for the board.

This Bulletin board or forum software has all the general features that a forum software should have. It also includes features such as :

  • News System with articles
  • ShoutBox
  • Threaded Mode for topics
  • JS DOCK for easy navigation(A first from AEF)
  • WYSIWYG Editors
  • Customizable Themes
  • Language Packs
  • Time Zone Adjustment
  • Automatic Updates
  • Export Files and Database
  • Suggest Framework for usernames while writing PM’s
  • Domdrag for reordering Categories, Forums, emoticons (A new feature included for the first time ever in a forum software.)

Try out AEF today!!!

Enjoy,
–The AEF Development Team

They also supply forum themes, And have a Webhosting service, With free domains etc…

What are your opinions? I’ll post screen shots of their forums in action later.

Read full topic
